meanings.definition: A person who holds a fee or fief.
meanings.sent1: The feoffors was responsible for managing the land.
meanings.sent2: The feoffors received the title to the estate.
meanings.sent3: The feoffors decided to host a grand feast on the fief.
meanings.sent4: The feoffors stood as the guardian of the fief like a sturdy oak tree.
meanings.sent5: The feoffors wore a crown symbolizing their ownership of the fief.

meanings.definition: To grant a fee or fief to.
meanings.sent1: The king decided to feoffors the loyal knight with a piece of land.
meanings.sent2: The lord feofforsed the brave warrior with a fertile estate.
meanings.sent3: The generous noble feofforsed the hardworking farmer with a small plot of land.
meanings.sent4: She feofforsed her best friend with the responsibility of caring for her garden.
meanings.sent5: The wise ruler feofforsed the wise sage with the task of advising the court.
